meanings.definition: To cross (a hybrid) with one of its parents or with an individual genetically identical to one of its parents.
meanings.sent1: She backcrossed the new plant with its original parent to strengthen its traits.
meanings.sent2: The breeder backcrossed the hybrid corn with the original strain for better yield.
meanings.sent3: The gardener accidentally backcrossed the tomato plant with a pumpkin, creating a strange hybrid.
meanings.sent4: He backcrossed his memories with reality, creating a blend of past and present.
meanings.sent5: The scientist backcrossed the bacteria to study the inheritance of specific genes.
